**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 121 2.0 **Traditions** [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 60 feet **Area** 10-foot burst **Duration** sustained up to 1 minute --- You create an echo of a powerful poltergeist, temporarily anchoring it to the area to terrorize and harm any opponents foolish enough to remain in the area. Because the poltergeist is a manifestation and is not truly present, it can't be attacked or hurt; it remains [invisible](/Conditions.aspx?ID=26) unless otherwise stated. When you Cast the Spell, and the first time you Sustain it on subsequent rounds, the poltergeist creates your choice of one of the following effects.
  • **Deathly Assault** ([negative](/Traits.aspx?ID=118)) The poltergeist focuses on one creature in the area and flies through that creature's space, dealing 4d10 negative damage ([basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save).
  • **Frighten** ([emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) The poltergeist becomes visible, appearing as a skeletal, ghostlike humanoid. Creatures in the area must attempt a Will save, becoming [frightened 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19) on a failure.
  • **Telekinetic Storm** ([force](/Traits.aspx?ID=75)) The poltergeist hurls debris and quasi-real objects around in the area. All creatures in the area take 4d8 force damage (basic Reflex save).
--- **Heightened (+2)** The damage of the deathly assault effect increases by 1d10, and the damage of the telekinetic storm effect increases by 1d8.
name: Pernicious Poltergeist
